title: Terry McAuliffe
added: In 2019, according to PolitiFact, McAuliffe made a "full flop" on late-term abortions, initially opposing a bill to deregulate them in February before supporting the same bill in April.<ref>{{cite news|last=Fiske|first=Warren |title=McAuliffe does full flop on late-term abortion bill|url=https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2019/apr/09/terry-mcauliffe/mcauliffe-does-full-flop-late-term-abortion-bil|work=PolitiFact|access-date=September 17, 2021|date=April 9, 2019}}</ref>

title: Terry McAuliffe
deleted: McAuliffe has not taken a clear stance on repealing Virginia's [[right-to-work law]]; he once stated he supports its repeal but later dodged the question.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.wvtf.org/news/2021-08-12/mcauliffe-not-saying-much-about-right-to-work-for-now | title = McAuliffe Not Saying Much About Right to Work... For Now

title: Terry McAuliffe

title: Terry McAuliffe
added: The political peril inflicted by Virginia Democratic gubernatorial nominee Terry McAuliffe’s education stances deepened when a father accused the Loudoun County School Board of covering up the rape of his teenage daughter in a high school bathroom.
The father was dragged out of a school board meeting and arrested when he attempted to confront the members about the assault of his daughter by a boy wearing a skirt in the girls’ bathroom.

title: Terry McAuliffe
deleted: The political peril inflicted by Virginia Democratic gubernatorial nominee Terry McAuliffe’s education stances deepened when a father accused the Loudoun County School Board of covering up the rape of his teenage daughter in a high school bathroom.
The father was dragged out of a school board meeting and arrested when he attempted to confront the members about the assault of his daughter by a boy wearing a skirt in the girls’ bathroom.

title: Terry McAuliffe
added: McAuliffe pardoned 227 people during his tenure, the most of any Virginia governor, and three times as many as his predecessor [[Bob McDonnell]].<ref>Sandy Hausman, [https://www.wvtf.org/news/2018-01-23/mcauliffe-pardoned-record-number-of-prisoners-but-hundreds-are-still-waiting McAuliffe Pardoned Record Number of Prisoners, But Hundreds Are Still Waiting], WVTF (January 23, 2018).</ref> In 2017, he granted pardons to the [[Norfolk Four]], a group of [[U.S. Navy]] sailors who were [[Wrongful conviction|wrongly convicted]] of a 1997 rape and murder and were declared [[actually innocent]] by a federal court in 2016.<ref>Priyanka Boghani, [https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/article/norfolk-four-pardoned-20-years-after-false-confessions/ "Norfolk Four" Pardoned 20 Years After False Confessions], ''Frontline'', PBS (March 22, 2017).</ref><ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/true-crime/wp/2017/03/21/norfolk-4-wrongly-convicted-of-rape-and-murder-pardoned-by-gov-mcauliffe/ 'Norfolk 4' wrongly convicted of rape and murder, pardoned by Gov. McAuliffe], ''Washington Post'' (March 21, 2017).</ref> He rejected an application for pardon from [[Jens Soering]].<ref>Laura Vozzella, [https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/virginia-politics/mcauliffe-wont-act-on-soering-pardon-before-leaving-office/2017/12/14/0d25d14c-e126-11e7-8679-a9728984779c_story.html McAuliffe won’t act on Soering pardon before leaving office], ''Washington Post'' (December 14, 2017).</ref>

title: Terry McAuliffe
deleted: During a campaign rally with [[Stacey Abrams]], who lost the [[2018 Georgia gubernatorial election]], McAuliffe declared that Abrams would have been elected Governor without "voter suppression" and claimed that Republicans "took the votes away". Election expert [[Richard Hasen]] criticized McAuliffe's comments, noting there is "no evidence" that Abrams would have been elected under different election laws.<ref>https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2021/10/25/terry-mcauliffe-should-not-fan-flames-voter-suspicion/</ref> McAuliffe had previously contested the legitimacy of the [[2000 United States presidential election]], claiming that the Supreme Court had "tampered" with the race.<ref>https://www.mediaite.com/politics/terry-mcauliffe-whos-blamed-opponent-for-embracing-big-lie-also-claims-stacey-abrams-had-election-stolen/</ref>
